posts.post_content: Takes a while to set up, but once you have 3-4 critters in the 'yard and a bunch of lands, this guy is unstoppable. In my first RTR draft, I lost to this guy because I couldn't figure out how to deal with him. (As it turns out, Rakdos's weakness is not having Arrest or Exile or Detain...)

Posted By: Viltris (10/9/2012 11:24:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I built a pretty fun Commander deck using him. It is a Black Green reanimator dredge style deck. It works very well. Most the time Jarad isn't that good in the early game because of how few creatures are in your graveyard at the time. But once the game starts to drag on a bit longer he becomes a powerful force. Usually I don't win using him, but rather the large creatures I reanimate. But when that strategy fails, Jarad is ready to beat people over the head for 20+ damage. I know Graveyard hate ruins the deck pretty hard, but the people I play with don't run graveyard hate that often.
posts.html:

Posted By: MANABURNWASGOOD (10/23/2012 7:27:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I ran this guy in sealed, and he was a BRICK HOUSE. His second ability was instrumental, and late game, I had no problem floating mana and sac'ing lands to bring his straight back to the field for round 2. It helped if I had my [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman) out to make use of the sac'ed lands.   
In constructed, he can be mediocre...unless he's in the right environment. In a BGx Frites deck, he could be incredible. Especially since unlike [Splinterfright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinterfright) or [Boneyard Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boneyard Wurm), he doesn't die completely with your graveyard should [Rakdos Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Charm) or [Tormod's Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tormod's Crypt) come a-knockin'.   
I can dig this guy.
posts.html:

In constructed, he can be mediocre...unless he's in the right environment. In a BGx Frites deck, he could be incredible. Especially since unlike Splinterfright or Boneyard Wurm, he doesn't die completely with your graveyard should Rakdos Charm or Tormod's Crypt come a-knockin'.
I can dig this guy.

posts.post_content:
I was playing a three-way game of Commander earlier today. I was using [Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord) in particular. I had a [Mossbridge Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mossbridge Troll) out, with plenty of Zombie tokens from a [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan), pumped it up to a 45/45, and sacrificed it to Jarad...   
  
Both Opponents took 45 life and died. Brought a tear to my eye...

Posted By: Jedijoe (10/29/2012 10:58:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This guy has tools as a Commander [The Mimeoplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Mimeoplasm) and [Karador, Ghost Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karador, Ghost Chieftain) only wish they had. His second ability wins games, period. Sure you can potentially do Mimeoplasm and [Triskelion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Triskelion), but that requires an arbitrarily large creature in a graveyard (like a [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction)) plus the Triskelion. Just sac a Lord of Extinction to this guy and odds are you've killed most of the people at the table, and if not they are likely very close to dead. In the event someone gets out of hand with Lifegain he's still able to get quite large and get in for 21 commander damage.  
  
Jarad is my commander and will remain so for the foreseeable future. Haters gonna hate.
posts.html:
This guy has tools as a Commander The Mimeoplasm and Karador, Ghost Chieftain only wish they had. His second ability wins games, period. Sure you can potentially do Mimeoplasm and Triskelion, but that requires an arbitrarily large creature in a graveyard (like a Lord of Extinction) plus the Triskelion. Just sac a Lord of Extinction to this guy and odds are you've killed most of the people at the table, and if not they are likely very close to dead. In the event someone gets out of hand with Lifegain he's still able to get quite large and get in for 21 commander damage.

Jarad is my commander and will remain so for the foreseeable future. Haters gonna hate.

posts.post_content:
Hilarious EDH general. While his mass-fling doesn't count as commander damage, its far too easy to just pump a creature to 40 power through cards like [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk), or [Wine of Blood and Iron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wine of Blood and Iron). Especially if you're starting with something like [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction), [Worldspine Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldspine Wurm), or [Mossbridge Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mossbridge Troll).  
  
Just disgusting amounts of damage. So you just bide your time until the major players of tapped out, or preoccupied before launching a 4 man 40+ damage head-shot.   
  
Honestly, his colors could not have been more perfect for this type of deck.
posts.html:
Hilarious EDH general. While his mass-fling doesn't count as commander damage, its far too easy to just pump a creature to 40 power through cards like Berserk, or Wine of Blood and Iron. Especially if you're starting with something like Lord of Extinction, Worldspine Wurm, or Mossbridge Troll.

Just disgusting amounts of damage. So you just bide your time until the major players of tapped out, or preoccupied before launching a 4 man 40+ damage head-shot.

Honestly, his colors could not have been more perfect for this type of deck.
